result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fernando Mejia

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:55 AM {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Fernando Mejia appeared by zoom audio.  Attorney Cassi Nelson appeared by zoom for Fernando Mejia.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. 

Mr. Mejia waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

recess: 9:00am 

NEXT:   Arraignment on 12/2/22 at 10:30am
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom conference] 
case called at 1:40pm
Defendant Fernando Mejia appears. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Nelson indicates that the Defense is waiving preliminary hearing time limits, but is asking that a preliminary hearing be scheduled. Attorney Nelson requests that Mr. Mejia be allowed to appear by Zoom conference for that hearing. 
recess 1:43pm 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on October 4th at 8:30am by Zoom Conference
Zoom Instructions

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Cassi Nelson
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 1:30pm  {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.}
Defendant Fernando Mejia appears.  Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance

The Court vacates warrant authorization.

The Court reinstates bond.

The Court reviews letter that indicates that Defendant remains eligible for SPD services. 

Preliminary Hearing time limits remain tolled. 
recess: 1:35pm 
NEXT: Status of Counsel on 9/2/22 at 1:30pm via zoom
Status of Counsel
Zoom OK
Letter from defendant requesting Zoom hearing
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Mr. Mejia called into JA post hearing, noting that he had used the incorrect zoom information, Mr. Mejia was informed of new hearing date(5/16/22--ma)

[ma] Case called at 9:45 AM 
Defendant Fernando Mejia does NOT appear in person or via zoom.  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the court record. 

ADA Teuber requests a warrant be issued, and any bond be held in defualt. 

The Court will order a bench warrant, the Court will find $1500 signature bond signed on 2/7 is in default. 
recess: 9:47am--reconvene: 9:48am

The Court realizes that Mr. Mejia recently applied for SPD services and is eligible, but no attorney was available to appear today.

The Court vacates previous orders; instead IMPOSES & STAYS warrant until next court date. 

recess: 9:49am 
NEXT: Status on 7/7/22 at 1:30pm (status of counsel?/Warrant imposed and stayed until this date)
Status of Counsel
Status conference on May 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 11:14AM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Fernando Mejia appears without counsel. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant advises that he has not been able to retain an attorney.
The Defendant confirms the De Pere address as being current.
Upon Court inquiry, the Defendant advises that he has trouble retaining private counsel, and expresses interest in applying for the Public Defender's Office.
The Court instructs the Defendant to contact the Jefferson County Public Defender's Office to apply for counsel and provides contact information.

The Court informs the Defendant that it will expect to know the direction of the case. Upon inquiry by the Defendant, the Court will allow the Defendant to appear via Zoom at the next hearing.

recess 11:19AM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 05/16 at 9:30AM via Zoom
Ok to convert 4/12 hearing to zoom
Status conference on April 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter from defendant re hearing

ADDRESS INFO for Fernando Mejia
Current: 1197 Coral St, De Pere, WI 54115 United States  (Effective: 03-24-2022)
Prior: 24 Pine Ridge Ct #4, Watertown, WI 53094
No updated address information - unable to forward.  (03/11) ML
Scheduling Order
Status conference on April 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Incomplete filing letter re PFAC mailed to Defendant

[ml] Case called at 1:56PM
Defendant Fernando Mejia in court, in custody without counsel. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for a Status of Counsel, however the Defendant advises that he has not yet been able to retain private counsel as he has been in custody on a PO hold. However, he states that he plans on retaining private counsel when he is released from custody in 03/24/22.
The Court sets this matter over for another Status of Counsel with enough time for the Defendant to retain counsel after being released.

recess 1:58PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 04/12 at 11:00AM
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (02/16) ML
Status conference on February 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

During the Intial Appearance on today's date, Att De La Rosa advised the parties that the Defendant does not quailfy for Public Defender's services. The Clerk forwarded both a Right to Counsel handout, as well as a Petition for a County Appointed Attorney along with his Bond over to the jail after intake.

[ml] Case called at 1:14PM
Defendant Fernando Mejia appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def does not qualify).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls any pending time limits and preserves all the Defendant's jurisdictional objections.

The Court requires a $1,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no contact with Victim 1, except for custody and placement regarding the minor child or children; exchange of the child or children shall be conducted through a third party; under no circumstances shall the alleged victim and Defendant reside together
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Victim 1

recess 1:24PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 02/23 at 1:15PM with in person appearances
